result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Finucane was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: **COURT ODERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM.**

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

**Restitution is set at zero.**

Obtain and maintain employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

No drugs.
No alcohol.
No contact with victim, Michelle C., without prior court approval.

Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John R Finucane

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant John R Finucane in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant John R Finucane in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO AMENDED CHARGE (DISORDERLY CONDUCT): Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.    Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 44 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 14 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Michelle C., 
   without prior court approval.  
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant John R Finucane in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant John R Finucane in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge to Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to WIsconsin State Statute(s) 947.01(1) and 68.075(1)(a) a Class B Misdemeanor."   mld

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant John R Finucane not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived the appearance of defendant, upon the request of defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-17-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant John R Finucane in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Bail / Bond Motion Withdrawn by defense counsel.  Discovery and offer received.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Ryan C.; MIchelle C. or their residence.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John R Finucane in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  
Defendant John R Finucane in custody.  
Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for John R Finucane
Current: 5252 Packard Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110 United States  (Effective: 03-07-2015)
Prior: 1216 Memorial Drive 18, South Milwaukee, WI 53172
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
